item.title: Shop
item.dc:creator: ariel
item.content:encoded:
It's just around the corner...

Please visit my Etsy store for now if you are interested in buying my work.

I have a very busy summer of exhibiting art and running my design studio ahead of me, but the Electronic Sketchbook Shop should be up and running within another several months. Check back in September!

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: ariel
item.content:encoded:
Hello world. I am Ariel Cotton, webmistress of The Electronic Sketchbook.

I'm an artist, interaction designer, inventor, web developer, UI/UX designer, visual designer, illustrator, technologist, music enthusiast, techie, cartoonist, nerd, and maker of things.

I live and die by being interdisciplinary.

Bio

Press

Contact

Bio

Throughout my childhood, all I wanted was to be an artist. It has been my most defining attribute for as long as I can remember. I practiced drawing rigorously, kept a sketch journal, attended art classes, and constantly buried myself in creative projects.

At age 12, I became obsessed with The Beatles, and made a fan site for them on AOL Hometown. After spending immense quantities of time browsing through Beatles fan forums, I found other fans who had also created websites, but from scratch using HTML and CSS. I set out to make a website of my own that way, and I have been developing in HTML and CSS ever since.

When I was 18, I began attending Cooper Union as an art and design student. Despite my incessant whining throughout high school that I would never need math or science, I found myself intrigued by the projects the engineers at Cooper were working on. I saw infinite potential to incorporate robotics, laser cutting, LEDs and various engineering concepts into my artwork. I took engineering classes while I was studying art, and gained a basic background in programming and electronics.

I graduated from Cooper two years ago, and have been making work across the art, design and technology spectrum ever since. I have interactive art exhibits, I make and publish comics, I develop concepts and prototypes for toy inventions, and I work as a product designer and front-end web developer. I can frequently be found at the Brooklyn hacker space NYCResistor, of which I am a member, frankensteining electronics, bits and pieces together.

I have an affinity for dark humor, trollish sarcasm, and psychedelic cartoons with gratuitous amounts of violence. Also, I am hopelessly addicted to music, the internet, and chocolate.

A Tribe Called Quest, AC/DC, Al Di Meola, Alexander Scriabin, Andres Segovia, The Animals, Animals As Leaders, Art Tatum, Arthur "Big Boy" Crudup, Aswad, Autolux, B.B. King, The Band of Gypsys, The Beach Boys, The Beastie Boys, The Beatles, The Bee Gees, Ben Folds Five, Bert Jansch, The Beta Band, Big Business, Billie Holiday, Billy Cobham, Black Sabbath, Blind Faith, Blind Lemon Jefferson, Bob Dylan, Bob Marley, Boogie Down Productions, The Byrds, Charlie Parker, Chick Corea, The Clash, Coldplay, Cream, D'Angelo, Dido, DJ Screw, Django Reinhardt, Dr. Dre, Deep Purple, The Donnas, The Doors, Early Man, Earth Wind & Fire, Elton John, Elvis Presley, Emerson Lake & Palmer, Eminem, Eric B & Rakim, Eric Clapton, Everclear, Ex-Centric Sound System, Fleetwood Mac, Flux Pavilion, Frank Zappa, Franz Liszt, Frederic Chopin, George Harrison, Guns 'N Roses, Hadag Nahash, Haim Cotton, Herbie Hancock, Igor Stravinsky, Jaco Pastorius, James Brown, James P. Johnson, James Taylor, Janis Joplin, Jeff Buckley, Jill Scott, The Jimi Hendrix Experience, Joanna Newsom, Joey Bada$$, Johann Sebastian Bach, Johannes Brahms, John Coltrane, John Lee Hooker, John McLaughlin, Jonathan Coulton, Joni Mitchell, Kendrick Lamar, Kim Leaman, Lauryn Hill, Led Zeppelin, Lee Perry, Lionel Belasco, Ludwig van Beethoven, Lynyrd Skynyrd, Mahavishnu Orchestra, The Mamas and the Papas, Maurice Ravel, Memphis Minnie, Meshuggah, Metallica, Miles Davis, Mindless Self Indulgence, Modeste Mussorgsky, Mohammed Abel Wahab, Muddy Waters, My Bloody Valentine, Natalie Imbruglia, Nas, Nazem Al Ghazali, Nirvana, The Notorious B.I.G., N.W.A., Paco de Lucia, Pink Floyd, The Pixies, The Polecats, Queen, Queens of the Stone Age, The Police, Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky, Radiohead, Raekwon, The Ramones, Return to Forever, Rick Wakeman, Robert Johnson, The Rolling Stones, Rusko, Robert Schumann, The Secret Machines, Sergei Rachmaninoff, Simon & Garfunkel, Siouxsie and the Banshees, Skream, Slayer, Snoop Dogg, Steely Dan, Steps Ahead, Stevie Wonder, Sting, The Strokes, Traffic, Truth Hurts, Tupac, Uzuhi, Van Halen, Velvet Revolver, The Velvet Underground, Weather Report, The White Stripes, The Who, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, The Wu-Tang Clan, and Yes. (I wasn't kidding when I said I was addicted to music, was I?)

Press

  • “A Portrait of Millennial Artist Ariel Cotton.” The Huffington Post, October 27 2014.
  • “These Dolls Let You 'Hug' A Loved One Miles Away.” The Huffington Post, October 7 2014.
  • “Art show ‘Gonna Put A Hacks On You’ blends electronics, clothing, sweets.” Technically Brooklyn, August 13, 2014.
  • “Totally wired! Gowanus artist’s work is electrifying.” The Brooklyn Paper, August 1, 2014. 28.
  • “Art Hack Day: From An Idea To A Deluge of Ideas.” Make Magazine, February 4, 2015.
  • “Distance Dolls, A Pair of Wireless Dolls That Let People Hug Loved Ones From Afar.” Laughing Squid, October 7, 2013.
  • “Ariel Cotton's Distance Dolls Help People Connect Long Distance.” Trend Hunter, October 8, 2014.
  • “Totally wired! Hackers throwing party robot-themed art party.” The Brooklyn Paper, May 26, 2015.
  • “Give Someone You Love A Long-Distance Hug Using This Doll.” Right This Minute, October 18, 2014.
  • “14 wacky projects at the NYC Resistor Interactive Show 2014.” Makery, June 17, 2014.
  • “Lonely No More! Distance Dolls Will Help You Feel Okay.” Daily Offbeat, October 8, 2014.
  • “April 23rd Senior Exhibitions at The Cooper Union.” How Was It? April 24, 2013.

Contact

If you enjoy what you're seeing and reading on this website or have any feedback or questions for me, please feel free to reach out to me via email or social media. I am currently accepting art commissions and freelance illustration, design, and web development work, and I relish the occasional collaboration now and then, so please get in touch if you are interested in working with me.

ariel@electricstud.io

item.title: Site launch and other things.
item.dc:creator: ariel
item.content:encoded:
Well, the site is basically as done as it’s going to get before my senior show in a couple of weeks. Improvements on my agenda for the summer include:
  • Making it responsive to smaller screens, including mobile devices.
  • Documenting my entire portfolio.
  • Smoothing out all the fine details and making the browsing experience even more seamless.
I just need to do some hasty cross-browser testing on Windows, and then I guess I’ll officially launch this thing. W00t. Time to get back to working on my conductive ink book and motorized dolls…and the countless other things I need to get done for my show. *headdesk*

item.title: One hell of a week.
item.dc:creator: ariel
item.content:encoded: This has been the best week I’ve ever had at Cooper Union, as well as the most fulfilled and certain about myself and my future I have felt in a long time. My show opening went swimmingly. I managed to get nearly everything working and installed in time, and tons of people showed up to give me support. I’ll definitely make a blog post devoted to documenting and discussing the show at some point in the near future, once I’ve taken photos and videos. Maybe this weekend. It’s ironic that this has been such a great week for me, given the horrible events that have recently taken place at Cooper. I really hope that this move to charge tuition doesn’t mean Cooper’s ideology is dying. My idealistic hopes are that it is merely taking a nap, and will eventually return. It’s so depressing to think about. I’ve spent the past couple of days indulging in well-earned laziness. Well, somewhat. I did go to work and class, but I have barely done any work outside of class. I’m beginning to smooth out the fine details in my site layout, but it’s hard for me to focus with the World Wide Web there to distract me. I definitely need a breather after this past year, particularly the past month and a half, what with the Trinity competition and my senior show. I’m so grateful that I have a trip to Italy to look forward to in mid-May. In other news, I’ve been going through one of my Beatles kicks these days. This one was mainly prompted by my long-overdue discovery of the Beatles Anthology. Check out these takes of “Strawberry Fields Forever.” The first one is so trippy and haunting. Everyone go check out the Beatles Anthology, y’all. I would update more, but I’m passing the fuck out here. As I said, stay tuned for a post on my show this weekend or something.
